trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet,jea
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet,jea

trans-unit.source: creating a domain controller
trans-unit.target: creating a domain controller

trans-unit.source: Creating a Domain Controller
trans-unit.target: Creating a Domain Controller

trans-unit.source: This document assumes that your machine is domain joined.
trans-unit.target: This document assumes that your machine is domain joined.

trans-unit.source: If you currently don't have a domain to join, this section can help you quickly stand up a domain controller using DSC.
trans-unit.target: If you currently don't have a domain to join, this section can help you quickly stand up a domain controller using DSC.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The machine is on an internal network
trans-unit.target: The machine is on an internal network

trans-unit.source: The machine is not joined to an existing domain
trans-unit.target: The machine is not joined to an existing domain

trans-unit.source: The machine is running Windows Server 2016 or has WMF 5.0 installed
trans-unit.target: The machine is running Windows Server 2016 or has WMF 5.0 installed

trans-unit.source: Install xActiveDirectory
trans-unit.target: Install xActiveDirectory

trans-unit.source: If your machine has an active internet connection, run the following command in an elevated PowerShell window:
trans-unit.target: If your machine has an active internet connection, run the following command in an elevated PowerShell window:

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an internet connection, install xActiveDirectory to another machine and then copy the xActiveDirectory folder to the "C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules" folder on your machine.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an internet connection, install xActiveDirectory to another machine and then copy the xActiveDirectory folder to the "C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules" folder on your machine.

trans-unit.source: To confirm the installation succeeded, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: To confirm the installation succeeded, run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Set up a domain with DSC
trans-unit.target: Set up a domain with DSC

trans-unit.source: Copy the following script in PowerShell to make your machine a Domain Controller in a new domain.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following script in PowerShell to make your machine a Domain Controller in a new domain.

trans-unit.source: **AUTHOR'S NOTE: THERE IS A KNOWN ISSUE WITH THE CREDENTIALS PROVIDED NOT BEING USED. TO BE SAFE, DON'T FORGET YOUR LOCAL ADMIN PASSWORD.**
trans-unit.target: **AUTHOR'S NOTE: THERE IS A KNOWN ISSUE WITH THE CREDENTIALS PROVIDED NOT BEING USED. TO BE SAFE, DON'T FORGET YOUR LOCAL ADMIN PASSWORD.**

trans-unit.source: Your machine will restart a few times.
trans-unit.target: Your machine will restart a few times.

trans-unit.source: You will know the process is complete once you see a file called "C:\temp.txt" containing "Domain has been created."
trans-unit.target: You will know the process is complete once you see a file called "C:\temp.txt" containing "Domain has been created."

trans-unit.source: Set up Users and Groups
trans-unit.target: Set up Users and Groups

trans-unit.source: The following commands will set up an Operator and Helpdesk group in your domain and a corresponding non-administrator user who is a member of that group.
trans-unit.target: The following commands will set up an Operator and Helpdesk group in your domain and a corresponding non-administrator user who is a member of that group.
